source.title: Good and Cheap: Eat Well on $4/Day
source.attribution: Text, recipes, and most photographs and design by Leanne Brown, in fulfillment of a final project for a master’s degree in Food Studies at New York University.
source.modified: PDF to machine format and other changes

name: Taco Salad
description: This salad is a great use for leftover beans (or pulled pork)—crunchy, fresh, yet satisfying enough to be a whole meal. I like to make taco salad in a week where I’ve made a large batch of beans and I’m craving something fresh.

required: 1 cup beans, pulled pork, or ground beef
sharp cheddar or queso fresco, for sprinkling

instructions:
Mix up the dressing and taste it. Adjust the salt, pepper, and lime to your liking. 

Mix the other ingredients in a large bowl. Pour the dressing over just before serving and toss to coat the salad evenly. Eat immediately, maybe with a few extra tortilla chips on the side.
